translated: The Elders’ Birth Stories🔽The Chapter about the Giver of Protection
The Story of the Elder Kandalimpuppha
“On the bank of the Sindhu River,
I was a farmer then;
I was engaged in other people’s work,
and I did not see another’s food.

analyzed: sindhum anucarantaḥ uha  siddhattham jinam addasa
translated: Wandering along the Sindhu,🔽I saw Siddhattha, the Victor;
As if sitting in concentration,
like a hundred-petaled flower in bloom.
Cutting off seven kandalipuppha flowers
by the stalk, then,
I placed them on my head,
on the Buddha, the Kinsman of the Sun.
The One Perfected, golden-hued,
concentrated in a favorable way;
Split into three, the elephant,
like an elephant, hard to approach.
Approaching him,
the skilled one, with developed faculties,
I raised my hands in respectful salutation,
and I bowed to the Teacher.
For ninety-four aeons,
the flower I placed on the Buddha’s head;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
The four analytical knowledges,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā kandalipupphiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Kandalipupphiyattherassāpadānaṁ navamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā kandalipupphiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽kandalipupphiya therassa apadānam navama
translated: Thus has the venerable Kandalapupphiya told this story in verse.🔽The Story of the Elder Kandalapupphiya is the ninth.
